pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:0.4: 7. The training rule on building dwellings
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Kosambī in Ghosita’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.2: At that time a householder who was a supporter of Venerable Channa said to him,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.3: “Venerable, please find a site for a dwelling, and I’ll have one built for you.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.4: While Venerable Channa was clearing a site for that dwelling, he had a tree felled that had served as a shrine and that was revered by village, town, district, and kingdom.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.6: “How can the Sakyan ascetics have such a tree felled?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.7: They are hurting life with one sense faculty.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.8: The monks heard the criticism of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.9: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.10: Venerable Channa in the same manner.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.11: After rebuking Venerable Channa in many ways, they told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and questioned Channa:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.12: “Is it true, Channa, that you had a tree felled that had served as a shrine and that was revered by village, town, district, and kingdom?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.15: “… Foolish man, how can you do such a thing?
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.16: People perceive trees as living beings.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.17: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.18: And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.19.1: ‘When a monk builds a large dwelling with a sponsoring owner and intended for himself,
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.20: he must get monks to approve a site where no harm will be done and which has a space on all sides.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:1.21: If a monk builds a large dwelling on a site where harm will be done and which lacks a space on all sides, or he does not get monks to approve the site, he commits an offense entailing suspension.’”

pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.82: Or he does not get monks to approve the site:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.83: if the site has not been approved through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements, and he then builds a dwelling or has one built, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.84: When one piece is left to complete the dwelling, he commits a serious offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.85: When the last piece is finished, he commits an offense entailing suspension.
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.86: He commits an offense entailing suspension:
pli-tv-bu-vb-ss7:2.87: … Therefore, too, it is called “an offense entailing suspension”.
